data.title: Flat plane meshes disappear at specific y positions
data.body:
I'm having a strange problem with flat MeshInstances not rendering if their global y position is exactly -1, or other specific values like -5 or +3 (every 4 units apart). I [uploaded a test project](https://github.com/sheepandshepherd/godot-octree-bug-test) to try figuring out what the issue is, and to make sure it isn't specific to my game.

As many details as I could get from the test project:  
- Non-flat meshes are fine.
- The disappearances only happen at those specific, consistent values. Moving the tiles up or down by even 0.001 causes them to appear normally.
- Whether the MeshInstance is saved in the scene or created at runtime makes no difference.
- I added TestCubes as children of all the tiles. The TestCubes that are children of the "invisible" tiles are rendered normally, and in their correct positions.
- The mesh used doesn't seem to matter; I originally had the problem with a simple quad exported from Blender, and the same thing happens with a simple plane created with SurfaceTool.
- I don't know if it has anything to do with culling, but rotating the camera around to any angle has no effect on which tiles are visible.
- The "invisible" tiles are also invisible in the editor.
- In the editor, moving an "invisible" tile to a different y position does not make it visible again until the scene is saved and reloaded.

Screenshot from the test project showing the quads being rendered in most of the MeshInstances, but those at y = -5/-1/+3/etc. are invisible:  
![Screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/p0emyE1.png)

Issue #3253 might be the same, although these MeshInstances are invisible at runtime as well as in the editor.

Finally, I noticed an octree error that might be related while I was testing. As mentioned above, moving the problematic MeshInstances up/down by 0.001 makes them visible again (they only disappear at specific integer values); however, if I do this in a function while the game is running, instead of the tiles becoming visible again, I get [this error message](http://i.imgur.com/NjLrAln.png) once for each "invisible" MeshInstance in the scene (but not for the properly rendered MeshInstances). Issue #3325 mentions this error as well, but in different circumstances.

Not sure how Godot's octree works, but because the "disappearing points" repeat consistently every 4 units, I wonder if completely flat meshes at the exact border between octree nodes are somehow not getting sorted into any node, and so not rendered at all. The octree error when moving "invisible" MeshInstances: `ERR_FAIL_COND( e.octant_owners.front()==NULL );`, from [here](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/math/octree.h#L942).

data.title: x11: set _net_wm_name property
data.body: Allows usage of unicode characters in the window title, fixes #2952

data.title: The HDR environmental filter is broken (makes everything black)
data.body:
My specs:: Windows 10 64 bit, 24 gigs RAM, third gen i7 CPU, and an ATI HD 7.xxx GPU using the Crimson drivers. The build used is a very recent one newer than the official beta.
# 

**The issue** - turning on the HDR in the environmental shading options causes the 3D viewport to become black. I know this is probably not a driver issue because basic HDR is fully functional if you go back to the alpha builds (though a few options are broken which has been the case since version 1).

---

Here's hoping that the developers are open to fixes in the area of 3D even though the renderer is going to be rewritten, it would be nice to have some of these things fixed in the meantime.

data.title: HTML5 template should notify user when WebGL support is missing
data.body:
When trying to run an export game using the 2.0-beta HTML5 template, I get:

```
has res dir: 
exists engine cfg? 0
loaded engine.cfg
Init OS
Could not create canvas: ?,:(,{"antialias":false,"alpha":false,"depth":true,"stencil":false,"majorVersion":1,"minorVersion":0}
Init Audio
Init VS
```

And no canvas is shown, instead: "Exception thrown, see JavaScript console".

It would be nice to get this one fixed for 2.0, as currently it seems HTML5 is completely broken.

I tested this with two projects so far:
- https://github.com/bojidar-bg/top-down-inertia (uses the TSCN format, converted on export to SCN)
- https://github.com/KOBUGE-Games/minilens (uses the XML format, also converted on export to SCN I guess)

data.title: HTML5 export issue with get_executable_path
data.body:
When running the 2.0-beta HTML5 template, I get (in Firefox, safe mode to prevent my ad blocker from letting hell break loose):

```
let it go!
[1;31mERROR: get_executable_path: [0m[1mWarning, don't know how to obtain executable path on this OS! Please override this function properly.
[0;31m   At: drivers/unix/os_unix.cpp:508.[0m
```

I'm not sure why it tries to use drivers/unix when it's the javascript platform, that might be a first clue. My test OS is indeed a Linux 64-bit though.

data.title: Two major UI issues with the shader visual node editor.
data.body:
This being present in very recent builds (newer than the beta).
## **Bug # 1**

When making a very long connection between an output socket and an input socket, the node editor view will scale 2x on the X axis (and then snap back when you do another edit).
## **Bug # 2**

Whenever a node is deleted, it will immediately invoke a grab operation on a random node and give it an offset relative to the mouse (deleting a selection should leave nothing selected and movable because what was selected was deleted).

---

These two bugs should be very simple to reproduce as you don't need any specific setup. These are also confirmed on a machine with Windows10 64 bit, an ATI 7xxx GPU with the Crimson drivers, a third-gen i7 GPU, and 24 gigs of RAM. I was also using the shader node editor by the way.

Hope this can be confirmed on your side and fixed.

Thanks.

data.title: Right panel extreme resizing problem.
data.body:
Head compiled few minutes ago. When the right panel (Inspector panel by default I think) is extremely resized to the left side by clicking, holding and dragging, the resize edge between the panel and editor window is not visible anymore. 
The problem appears when to edge starts to overlap icon/menu/tabs of the editor's section of the screen, to be exact.
When mouse holding is released in that position, the right panel resizing is not possible from that point, because panel edge is not visible.
The only way user can get the edge of the Inspector panel back is to open animation editor, debugger or output console that creates an edge between panels.

Probably related to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3565

data.title: Compiler Error on Custom Module
data.body:
I am getting the following error for a module I'm working on:

```
modules/NewHTTPClient/src/NewHTTPClient.cpp: In static member function 'static void NewHTTPClient::_bind_methods()':
modules/NewHTTPClient/src/NewHTTPClient.cpp:301:73: error: cannot call member function 'bool NewHTTPClient::configureTLS()' without object
  ObjectTypeDB::bind_method("configureTLS",&NewHTTPClient::configureTLS());
                                                                         ^
modules/NewHTTPClient/src/NewHTTPClient.cpp:302:83: error: cannot call member function 'void NewHTTPClient::startDataTransfer()' without object
  ObjectTypeDB::bind_method("startDataTransfer",&NewHTTPClient::startDataTransfer());
```

The module works fine in my test with a main function, but plugging it into Godot is a hangup for me. Any ideas?

data.title: Unable to scroll script editor horizontally with mouse horizontal scrolling feature

```
********* listening on port 6007

has connection!

```

data.title: Deleting a node deletes all animation tracks referencing that node.
data.body:
I noticed this while working on a game for Global Game Jam this past weekend. Say you have an animation set up in the animation player, and you are referencing a node that exists in the current scene file; If you then delete that node, any tracks that reference it will also be deleted.

I can see how this might make sense, but I found myself in a situation where I lost a good chunk of work:

I had a item–a sword specifically–attached to the player, and was animating it from the player scene. I later decided that it should be a pickup and removed it from the player, deleting several animations. Since you can create animations that reference a node path that doesn't exist, and then add the node via script at run time, I had assumed this would work, but instead wound up having to redo my work.

Given that we can create an animation with an invalid path, and that the engine will provide a helpful error if the path isn't valid at runtime, should Godot not keep the animation tracks? Or ask before deleting them?

data.title: modifier keys are not detected in Input. polling under _process(delta)
data.body:
This code does not work for me either in _process or _fixed_process. I am using Godot Beta OSX release (the one on the website not the master).

```
func _ready():
    set_process(true)
func _process(delta):
   if(Input.is_key_pressed(KEY_ESCAPE)):
      if(Input.is_key_pressed(KEY_SHIFT)): # here nothing is detected
         get_tree().quit()
```

Modifier keys are not detected at all. I tried shift, control, meta nothing.  The only way I can detect them is event.shift in _input(event) and worst of all they can only be detected when modifying another key (see below). Has something changed or is this intentional or is it my system? I am following an older tutorial that did it this way so I assume it used to work before. 

the tutorial is here
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2015/01/28/Godot-Engine-Tutorial-Part-3-Program-Lifecycle-and-Input-Handling.aspx

So as i said before modifiers only get detected in events under _input(event) the event.shift (or any other modifier specific event) is not detected unless another key is pressed making Shift press detection  by itself currently impossible.

if (control.shift): # this works but the input event is not triggered when shift (or any modifier is pressed by itself) so nothing happens until you press another random key 

And last point is Shift (or any other modifier key) does not work by themselves in InputMap (I made another issue for this one #3551)

data.title: modifier keys (shift, ctrl...) should also work by themselves in input map
data.body: Generally games don't really care much about modifier keys other than just another button to press.  I'm asking for the ability to use Shift, Control, Alt, Meta, Function, Caps Lock as extra buttons  by themselves in Input Map. Right now they only work when modifying another key and not by themselves.

data.title: Signal "item_selected" in class Tree not working correctly
data.body:
tree = get_node("Tree")
tree.connect("item_selected",self,"item_selected")

When select mode SELECT_SINGLE is set, the signal will never fire.
When select mode SELECT_ROW is set, the signal will fire as often as columns are set in tree (sic :D).

As a side note: the "item_activated" and "cell_selected" signals are working comprehensible in this combinatons.

data.title: FileDialog won't show files in current directory when shown.
data.body:
```
fileselectpopup.set_mode(FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_FILE)
fileselectpopup.set_access(FileDialog.ACCESS_FILESYSTEM)
fileselectpopup.add_filter("*.csv;comma separated files")
fileselectpopup.set_pos(get_viewport_rect().size / 2 - fileselectpopup.get_size() /2)
fileselectpopup.show()

#if set_current_dir is not processed _after_ .show(), FileDialog will open
#in current dir, but not showing files.
fileselectpopup.set_current_dir(".")
```

data.title: binaries don't work on fedora
data.body:
If I download Godot from the website it won't run. It will complain that libssl and libcrypto are missing. 

```
error while loading shared libraries: libssl.so.10: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

and a similar error for libcrypto.
Now I believe this is a ancient issue that exists for whatever reason and no one has got a good solution for it so far.

The libs are there and installed but the naming is different and I guess the versions are different I tried to work around it by creating symlinks, and what not, but without success.

I suggest we just upload binaries that were built on fedora for fedora users. because even if we found a way to work around it the whole download and run without installation thing will lose its meaning.

I can build and send the binaries, just tell me which commit to checkout to.
